author: Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, Clifford Stein
description: A comprehensive introduction to algorithms, covering both the theoretical and practical aspects of algorithms and data structures.

author: James Kurose, Keith Ross
description: A top-down approach to computer networking, focusing on the application layer, transport layer, and networking technologies.

author: Abraham Silberschatz, Peter B. Galvin, Greg Gagne
description: A widely used textbook for operating system principles, covering fundamental concepts in OS design and implementation.

author: Raghu Ramakrishnan, Johannes Gehrke
description: A detailed exploration of database systems, covering topics like relational databases, SQL, normalization, and more.

author: David Money Harris, Sarah L. Harris
description: A book focused on digital design, covering logic circuits, computer architecture, and assembly language programming.

author: Kenneth H. Rosen
description: A comprehensive introduction to discrete mathematics, focusing on logic, set theory, combinatorics, and graph theory.

book_name: Data Structures and Algorithms in C++
author: Adam Drozdek
description: A detailed guide to data structures and algorithms in C++, with clear examples and practical implementations.

author: Stuart Russell, Peter Norvig
description: A comprehensive introduction to artificial intelligence, covering search algorithms, knowledge representation, learning, and reasoning.

author: Roger S. Pressman
description: A guide to software engineering principles, focusing on software development processes, design, testing, and maintenance.

book_name: Introduction to the Theory of Computation
author: Michael Sipser
description: An introduction to the theoretical aspects of computer science, covering automata, computability, and complexity theory.
